clinical_study.brief_title: Fatigue and Inspiratory Muscles Training in Patients With Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: Fatigue and Inspiratory Muscles Training Against Resistance in Patients With Multiple Sclerosis With Severe Disabilities

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the effect of a training of the inspiratory muscles against resistance at home during 10 weeks in multiple sclerosis patients with a severe disability.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients will be informed about the study procedures during a follow-up consultation or an hospitalization in a Physical and Rehabilitation Medicine Unit. If they give their informed consent to participate in the study, an investigator will randomize them into one of the 2 arms of the study. This study consists of 3 visits. The first visit (inclusion) is planned at day 0, the second visit 10 weeks later and the third 3 months after day 0. A patient who is randomized in the experimental arm will have to follow 10 weeks of rehabilitation of the inspiratory muscles at home between first and second visit. During this period, investigators will call these patients once a week to assess the compliance with the rehabilitation. The patients who have been randomized in the control group will not follow this rehabilitation program.

primary_outcome.measure: Fatigue graded according to EMIF-SEP questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: EMIF-SEP questionnaire (French valid version of the Fatigue Impact Scale, self-administered questionnaire to measure fatigue in multiple sclerosis patients)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep disorders graded according to the Epworth Sleepiness Scale
Quality of life graded according to the SEP-59 questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: SEP-59 questionnaire (french validated self-administered questionnaire to assess quality of life in multiple sclerosis patients)

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximal inspiratory pressure graded according to the Black and Hyatt method
secondary_outcome.description: respiratory manometer according to Black and Hyatt method

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximal expiratory pressure graded according to Black and Hyatt method
secondary_outcome.description: respiratory manometer according to Black and Hyatt method

secondary_outcome.measure: Forced vital capacity (FVC) graded with a portable spirometer
Tidal volume graded with a portable spirometer
Forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) graded with a portable spirometer
FEV1/ FVC ratio graded with a portable spirometer
Depression graded according to the French version of the Beck Depression Inventory Fast-Screen
secondary_outcome.description: French version of the Beck Depression Inventory Fast-Screen, validated scale in multiple sclerosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Swallowing problems graded according to the DYMUS score
Level of disability graded by the EDSS (Expanded Disability Status Scale)
secondary_outcome.description: These functional parameters will enable the assessment of the level of disability by a clinical examination

secondary_outcome.measure: Collection of the drug treatments received evaluated by a questionnaire

arm_group.description: Respiratory rehabilitation: Powerbreathe training of the inspiratory muscles at home twice a day (2 sessions of 30 inspirations / day) during 10 weeks

intervention.description: 10 minutes 2 times a day : 30 inspirations per session during 10 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with remitting or progressive multiple sclerosis defined by McDonald criteria revised in 2005, with an EDSS between 6 and 7,5
- Aged between 18 and 65 years
- Patients able to maintain the Powerbreathe
- Not to have had a flare-up since at least 6 weeks
- Patients at least 4 weeks since a corticoid bolus
- Patients at least 6 weeks since a botulinum toxin injection
- Patients at least 4 weeks since a pulmonary infection
- Questionnaire EMIF-SEP >= 55
- Patients given their informed consent
- Patients who benefit or are affiliated to a social security regimen
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with neurologic antecedents other that multiple sclerosis
- Patients with respiratory disorders other than those induced by multiple sclerosis
- Patients with orthopedic, cardiac, and rheumatologic invalidating antecedents
- Patients with comprehension or cognitive disorders impeding the realization of rehabilitation
- Pregnant women
- Patients under legal guardianship, or safeguard of justice
- Patients participating or planning participate within the 3 months of the study to another clinical research project
